communication
Interface ClientInterface

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
public interface ClientInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote

Overview

This is the interface of the client: it shows the kind of actions that a client can handle.

Responsibilities

Since the game logic is in the server, the server has to notify the client about change turns, so this interface specify what is the action that the server can call on the client in order to notify it about a change turn.

Collaborators

This interface is implemenented in ServerHandler in the Client part of the project and its methods are called by the class ClientHandler in the Server in order to notify the client about change turns.

Version:
1.0
Author:
RAA

Method Summary
 void handleChangeTurn(java.lang.String theCurrentPlayerUsername)
          The method handleChangeTurn is called by the server in order to notify clients about a change turn.
 void ping()
          The method ping is called by the server in order to check connectivity with the client.
 

Method Detail

handleChangeTurn

void handleChangeTurn(java.lang.String theCurrentPlayerUsername)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
The method handleChangeTurn is called by the server in order to notify clients about a change turn. If the notification can be performed, the function ends normally without any return value, otherwise, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
theCurrentPlayerUsername - is the name of the player that from now on will own the turn
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a connection error
See Also:
GameManager, SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler

ping

void ping()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
The method ping is called by the server in order to check connectivity with the client. If the check can be performed, the function ends normally without any return value, otherwise, an exception is thrown. The action performed depends strongly on the implementations: some implementation may not be compatible with this method. In that case, the function simply does nothing.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a connection error
See Also:
RMIServerHandler
